description: Harry has discovered that Peter is Spider-Man. Now the Green Goblin is beginning to haunt him.
name: Partners in Danger Chapter 8: The Return of the Green Goblin

deck: From Lake Titicaca comes a legend.
description:
When Beavis & Butt-Head step up to take a diarrhetic Stewart his homework, the dumbass duo's introduction to breakfast burritos ultimately leads to the birth of... The Great Cornholio! How will Highland High react to the arrival of this mysterious individual? Where is this enigma from? What does he need? Don't make his bungholio angry by not finding the answers for yourself. Come out with your pants down and see the debut of one of the most popular recurring characters in the Beavis & Butt-Head series.

Beavis and Butt-Head review videos from the bands Sausage, Danger Danger, and Devo.
name: The Great Cornholio

description: Mary Jane has returned! And she has taken the starring role in an unfinished movie. But when an illusionist brings her father back and lures her into a trap, Spider-Man turns to Mysterio for help.
name: Partners in Danger Chapter 9: The Haunting of Mary Jane Watson

description: Spider-Man has revealed his true identity to Mary Jane and has asked her to marry him. She accepts. But now, a band of lizard beings kidnap Dr. Conners and take him into the sewers, claiming him to be their father.
name: Partners in Danger Chapter 10: Lizard King

description: Hobie Brown has always wanted power. After he saves Kingpin's son, Kingpin offers him a new battle suit. Hobie soon takes on the name "The Prowler". But when Kingpin double-crosses him, Hobie turns to Spider-Man for help.
name: Partners in Danger Chapter 11: The Prowler

deck: Night falls in the Devil Desert, and Oolong forks over his only DynoCap; a two storey mobile home. As the gang hunkers down for the night, their temporary residence is visited first by Yamcha and Pu'ar, and then later on by Mai and Shu -- both with the intention of stealing their Dragon Balls!
description:
Original Title: (Mayonaka no Houmonsha-tachi)

Night falls in earnest as Oolong forcibly offers up his only DynoCap, a large mobile home for Goku & Bulma sleep in for the night. After telling off Oolong, Bulma takes a shower and prepares for bed, while at the table, Goku explains what the Dragon Balls are to Oolong, little knowing that those who wish to steal the very same marbles have begun to close in around them! First the intrepid duo of Mai & Shu, acting on Emperor Pilaf's commands, attempts to plant an explosive beneath the motor-car. The plan goes awry soon after, however, but Shu manages to adjust the countdown, averting imminent danger for the moment. Later on, the witty duo of Yamcha & Puar sneak up to the parked vehicle to eavesdrop, but Yamcha inadvertently gains a view he is in no way prepared for! Yamcha quickly recovers, and soon resolves to get over his shameful fear starting now (fat chance!).

Within, Bulma announces that she doesn't want either of the boys sneaking up stairs while she sleeps. In response, Oolong slips them both a drink that contains a sleeping agent. Goku then nods off at the table, while Bulma yawns and retires upstairs. Grasping this golden opportunity, Oolong creeps upstairs, little knowing that Yamcha and Pu'ar break in the motor-home at roughly the same time. Yamcha commands Pu'ar to draw "Bulma" away from the vehicle. But, sure enough things go amusingly wrong.When morning dawns the gang head off, only, they spot Yamcha & Pu'ar pursuing them from the side. Out of the blue, Yamcha takes out an RPG and aims it at the motor home, causing it to explode and immediately careen off-course. But then, in a strange twist, Yamcha immediately returns and even supplies the stranded gang with a new vechile -- concealing a hidden tracking device.

Goku and the other then set off on their way, with Yamcha following them from a distance, quietly plotting to snatch the Dragon Balls from them at the last moment to grant his wish.
name: Keep an Eye on the Dragon Balls

deck: The gang arrive at the foot of Fire Mountain, a legendary land formation permanently bathed in a sea of flames that is said to be the castle of the fearsome Ox King. The Dragon Radar detects that the 6th Dragon Ball is located in the treasure trove on top. But how on Earth will our adventurers go about retrieving it? And what'll happen when the terror-striking king finds them trespassing on his land?!
description:
Original Title: (Furaipan-yama no Gyuumaou)

Our trio begins this adventure hurling ever further towards the legendary Fire Mountain where both the Ox-King, and the next Dragon Ball, are said to lie in wait. Oolong grows considerably nervous, while Goku & Bulma remain unshaken. That is, until they realise that the sunset they had been admiring up ahead is actually Fire Mountain!

Switch over in the mean-term to a concerned Mai & Shu, whose worst nightmares about returning to their emperor empty handed are confirmed true by way of a frightful electrocution! And then, trading off to Yamcha & Puar, they have an unusual encounter with a peculiar young kid..But Yamcha easily dispatches her when he thinks she tries to attack him.

Returning to matters, Goku and the others begin to explore the area, only to come afoul of the Ox-King! Furious over their trespassing, Goku engages in a fight with the Ox-King, but soon overcomes him once he utilises the Flying Nimbus in battle. The Ox-King surprisingly recognises the cloud and straight away asks him who gave him the magical object. Goku replies that it was the old pervert Roshi, to which the Ox-King rejoices --and reveals that he used to train under the venerable master along side Goku's Grandpa Gohan.

The Ox-King eventually tasks Goku with the business of visiting Master Roshi to retrieve an object he thinks might quench the flames of Fire Mountain, and also adds in an extra request that he find his loving daughter Chi-Chi. Yamcha, who had been listening in to their exchange the entire time flinches when he sees the picture the Ox-King holds up of his daughter -- it was the girl he defeated earlier!

Goku complies and sets off on his way, but will he be able to find Chi-Chi? And, more pressing still, will the wizened old turtle hermit have the means to dispel the flames of Fire Mountain?
name: The Ox King On Fire Mountain

deck: The gang go on a business trip to Elbonia.
description:
Plot Summary

When Dilbert and his coworkers fly to Elbonia on a business trip, they are astonished by the differences in culture and living conditions. While Dilbert tries to improve things for the workers, Wally gathers a following and becomes a messianic figure to the locals, and Alice falls in love with the local children.
name: Elbonian Trip

deck: The time comes to test out the Gruntmaster 6000.
name: Testing

description:
Two brothers, Sam (Jared Padalecki, "Gilmore Girls") and Dean Winchester (Jensen Ackles, "Smallville"), witness their mother's paranormal death as children and grow up trained to fight by a distraught father who wants nothing more than to hunt down the thing that killed his wife. Sam escapes to college to start a new, normal life, but gets pulled back in after Dean shows up on his doorstep to tell him their father is missing. Following clues from their father's eerie phone message, the boys travel to a small town and encounter a violent and vengeful spirit called the "Woman in White."

Eric Kripke wrote the episode directed by David Nutter.
name: Pilot

deck: One of two pilot episodes broadcast before the series began.
description:
Plot Summary

The Powerpuff Girls take on Fuzzy Lumpkins, after he loses a contest and decides to take his anger out on the people of Townsville. Fuzzy invents a gun that can turn anything into meat, with devastating consequences.
name: Meat Fuzzy Lumkins

description:
Plot Summary

Mojo Jojo comes up with a plan to enslave the residents of Townsville, by turning them into dogs.
name: Monkey See, Doggie Do

deck: A seemingly perfect woman steals the Professor's heart.
description:
Plot Summary

Professor Utonium thinks his luck has finally changed when he meets Ima Goodlady, a sweet and beautiful woman with a keen romantic interest in him. But the Powerpuff Girls soon realise that she is a fraud, as she is horrible to the girls when their father isn't around. They try to warn him, but he pays no attention, blinded by his feelings for Ima.
name: Mommy Fearest

description:
Plot Summary

Bubbles becomes afraid when her cherished toy, a stuffed octopus named Octi, begins to speak and behave strangely. But what she does not know is that her toy is being controlled by the Powerpuff Girls' most fearsome opponent: HIM.
name: Octi Evil

deck: Three villains exact their revenge on the Powerpuff Girls.
description:
Plot Summary

In a case of mistaken identity, the girls are apprehended for a series of crimes they did not commit. They soon discover that a group of villains, having been repeatedly defeated by the Powerpuff Girls, have decided to dress up as them and cause trouble in Townsville.
name: Powerpuff Bluff

deck: The Powerpuff Girls fight Roach Coach.
description:
Plot Summary

The Powerpuff Girls must overcome their fear of bugs when Roach Coach tries to infest the entire world with his cockroach army.
name: Insect Inside

deck: The Amoeba Boys make the entire city sick.
name: Gesundfight

deck: Goku and Chi-Chi fly off in search of Master Roshi, hopefully to acquire to the Bansho Fan to banish the sea of flames engulfing Fire Mountain. When Master Roshi fails to find the item, he decides to personally solve the matter himself. He, an old man?! How...?!
description:
Original Title: (Kamesen'nin no Kamehameha)

Goku & Chi-Chi make it to Kami House and meet up with the venerable Master Roshi. The old hermit instantly remarks that "the last time (he) saw (Goku's companion) she was taller, and prettier...and bigger.." . But alas, Goku explains that it isn't Bulma but in fact Chi-Chi, the Ox-King's daughter, and goes on to say what they have come here for. Regretfully, Roshi reveals that he threw out the Bansho Fan, seemingly the only means with which they could have dispelled the flaming sea, after he mistook it for a coaster and ended up staining it.

Disheartened, Roshi attempts to lighten up the pair's mood by offering to solve the matter personally. After he calls forth Baby Gamera, he sets off after them to Fire Mountain. Arriving there, Ox-King at once heaps praises on the old master's head, while Roshi himself has to take a moment to recover, as the motion of riding on top of Baby Gamera causes extreme dizziness. Once recovered, he scolds the Ox-King, who begs for forgiveness much to the surprise of Goku & the others.

Roshi then goes about preparing to deal with the raging fire. After removing his turtle shell and laying aside his stick, he clambers up onto a wall and, by flexing his scrawny muscles, instantly adopts a more hulk-like state. Muscles rippling, he begins to set up the mighty Kamehameha, a technique that took half a century to refine to perfection. Roshi fires off the blast attack directly at the mountain to the astonishment of the gang. Yet, as the smoke clears and the dust begins to settle, it soon becomes apparent that, not only did Roshi quench the flames, he also obliterated the entire mountain as well!

Mere minutes after watching the technique being carried out, Goku tries his hand at firing a Kamehameha and successfully launches it at the gang's capsule car, much to the complete amazement of Master Roshi. After a while spent chatting and of course filled with cheeky hijinks, everyone parts ways once again, and Goku & Bulma, with yet another Dragon Ball in hand, resume their quest in earnest, the end finally within sight at last!
name: The Kamehameha Wave

deck: Running low on fuel, Goku and the gang head for a remote village to fill up. As Bulma goes off shopping for a new outfit, her present Bunny costume seems to instil terror into the hearts of the local residents, whom she learns have been frightened by the presence of The Rabbit Mob invading town. Bulma issues a challenge to the gang member, but at what cost?
description:
Original Title: (Usagi Oyabun no Tokui)

Goku, Bulma & Oolong next stop off in a remote village to restock and refuel. Bulma heads into town, dressed in the same bunny outfit Oolong loaned her on account of her not having any other clean cloths to wear. Straight off the bat she notices that the villagers are reacting to her presence, usually out of fear. She shops a around in the meantime, availing of the town's uncanny kindness to her. It takes until she changes into a completely different outfit in another shop, after ridding herself of those preposterous rabbit ears to learn the truth; the locals have been terrorized by punks calling themselves the Rabbit Mob.

Two armed men from this supposed gang eventually notice Bulma and start to flirt with her, but is thankfully immune to their charm and sics Goku on them, beating them up. Acting bitter over being defeated, they call up 'the Boss' and pleads with him to come to them and dispose of such insolence. Soon enough, a bizarre white car featuring rabbit ears on top rolls up and out of it comes 'the Boss,' Monster Carrot, a bipedal, humanoid giant rabbit. Yamcha, having trailed the intrepid trio thus far, recognizes Monster Carrot, but cannot remember until he makes hand contact with Bulma after she slaps away his attempt at a hand shake -- Yamcha then remembers that the evil rabbit's touch has the power to turn others into carrots!

(It is humorous to point out that at a certain stage, Bulma the carrot falls into Goku's possession, which in itself is a pun; as is revealed much later on in the manga and its later anime adaptation Dragon Ball Z, Goku's real, 'Saiyan' name is in fact Kakarot -- a play on the word 'carrot'.)

As Goku launches into an attack, he soon surrenders when Monster Carrot threatens to eat Bumla. The Rabbit underlings then proceed to wail on Goku unchallenged, but they are interrupted by the intervention of Yamcha & Pu'ar, who decide to expose themselves in order to help out. Eventually, the mad scuffle finishes with Monster Carrot and his two men all tied up, and Goku uses his Power Pole to drop them off on the moon.
name: Boss Rabbit's Magic Touch

deck: Buttercup develops a crush on Ace.
name: Buttercrush

deck: The Boogie Man tries to take over Townsville.
description:
Plot Summary

The Boogie Man - an evil, disco-obsessed monster who loves to scare children - comes up with a plan to take over the town. He erects a giant disco ball to block out the sun, plunging Townsville into perpetual night and allowing all his monster friends to take to the streets and party. The girls come up with a plan to take him down, in a brilliant homage to Star Wars.
name: Boogie Frights

deck: The Powerpuff hotline falls into enemy hands.
description:
Plot Summary

The Ganggreen Gang obtain the Powerpuff Hotline, and spend the day making prank calls. But by sending the girls on a series of false assignments, they attract the attention of Townsville's villains.
name: Telephonies

deck: The people of Townsville turn on the Powerpuff Girls.
description:
Plot Summary

When HIM releases a gas into the city, it affects the mind of everyone who lives there, poisoning them against the girls.
name: Tough Love

deck: A new hero arrives in Townsville.
description:
Plot Summary

When a new superhero named Major Man shows up in Townsville, the girls soon feel pushed out. Super fast and strong, with a knack for turning up at just the right moment, Major Man soon has the people of the city eating out of the palm of his hand. They quickly forget about the Powerpuff Girls. But it isn't long before they begin to suspect that their new perfect hero may not be all that he claims to be.
name: Major Competition

deck: Bubbles tries to prove her worth to the other girls.
description:
Plot Summary

The Powerpuff Girls use a combat simulator to hone their skills, but Bubbles is hurt when the Professor turns the machine to one of it's lowest settings so that she won't hurt herself. After her sisters tease her about being the baby of the group, Bubbles snaps, and decides to prove she is just tough as either of her sisters.
name: Bubblevicious
In the Dead of the Night
Dead Night and the Dead Ruck

deck: The Powerpuff Girls pay tribute to the Beatles classic, Yellow Submarine.
description:
Plot Summary

A happy-go-lucky clown has his life turned upside down after a freak accident. He is hit by a truck full of bleach which spills all over him, draining him of colour and turning him into the evil Mr Mime. Bitter and full of rage, he sets out to drain all the colour and happiness from the world.

After Bubbles cracks and begins to fly all over town colouring things in with her crayons, the girls come up with a more practical solution, finding a way to use music to reverse Mr Mime's curse and restore him to his former self.
name: Mime for a Change
